message_1: Two drivers are approaching each other on a straight road. Driver A is driving at 60 miles per hour and Driver B is driving at 40 miles per hour. They both decide to play the Chicken Game, where the first driver to swerve to avoid a head-on collision is labeled a "chicken." If neither driver swerves, they will both crash and die. At what distance should Driver A begin to swerve to avoid being labeled a "chicken"? Assume that the drivers have the same reaction time and assume that the road is straight and flat, so there are no hills or curves to take into account.
